N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2606.5 - Procedure for requesting State assistance

State Regulations
(a) During the time period specified by the
corporation in a notice published pursuant to section
2606.3
(d) of this

Part, a project owner may submit to the corporation a request for State
assistance for any project within one or more of the eligible project
categories identified by the corporation. Such request for State assistance
shall include a properly completed and duly executed RFA form and State
assistance contract, including all required attachments for both
documents. (b) The corporation shall
have no obligation to approve, or disapprove any request for State assistance
unless and until the following has been satisfied: (1)
the corporation has received a properly
completed and duly executed municipal application from a municipality
identified in the RFA form; (2)
the
corporation has received written approval of the project by a municipality
identified in the RFA form, in the form of a properly completed municipal
approval form, or a duly adopted resolution of the governing body of such
municipality specifically identifying and approving the project for
participation in the FAB Program; (3)
all required reviews of the project, pursuant to SEQRA have been completed; and
(4)
any other requirements of the eligible
project description published pursuant to section
2606.3
(d) of this

Part have been satisfied. Once EFC determines that the requirements of this
paragraph are fully satisfied, the application shall be considered
complete. (c) Subject to
funds availability, the corporation shall make State assistance payments
available to project owners: (1)
on a
first-come/first-served basis, as measured by the date on which the corporation
determines it has received a complete application; or
(2)
using criteria or methodologies set forth
in the eligible project description published pursuant to section
2606.3
(d) of this

Part. The corporation may approve an application for funding but withhold
payment until certain conditions or requirements of this Part are
satisfied. Notes
